intro: Verbascum × nothum subsp. nouelianum, commonly known as the hybrid mullein, is a perennial plant characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, lobed leaves. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which is part of the family Scrophulariaceae. This subspecies is a natural hybrid between Verbascum nothum and Verbascum nouelianum, resulting in a unique combination of traits from both parents. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
